title.narrative: NATIONAL CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2016, a comprehensive child protection system developed and functional., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, vulnerable children in the most vulnerable districts have access to functioning child protection systems and services that protect them from violence, abuse, and exploitation

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF BASIC AND SECONDARY EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, a comprehensive child protection system developed and functional.

description.narrative: The approved Child Protection policy, National Plan of Action and equipment support to Government enhanced the child protection system for children and their families in the Gambia. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of child protection standards available.
Number of functional Child Protection Committees
Availability of a validated national child protection strategy and action plan and monitoring system
Existence of revised policies and laws on birth registration in line with international standards.
Policy and legal frameworks costed and in place, and regularly monitored to prevent and respond to violence, abuse and exploitation of children.
